committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to require that the United States Postal Service report to Congress at least 60 days before acting on any decision to close or consolidate a post office.

summary.text: Requires the U.S. Postal Service to submit to the Congress its written determination to close or consolidate a post office. Prohibits the Service from taking any such action until 60 days after such notification, or 60 days after the Postal Rate Commission reports to the Congress its decision to affirm a determination which had been appealed.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to require that the United States Postal Service report to Congress at least 60 days before acting on any decision to close or consolidate a post office.
